title: Revisiting Patricia Arquette's 'Boyhood' Journey
teaser: We revisit our July conversation with Patricia Arquette, star of Boyhood, now nominated for five Golden Globe awards.
contentencoded:
One of the most talked about films this summer was no overnight sensation.

Richard Linklater’s fictional movie, “Boyhood,” was filmed over 12 years. Audiences watched the entire cast, including the lead character, Mason, played by Ellar Coltrane, grow up.

But it’s Patricia Arquette who plays Mason’s mother, who’s surrounded by Oscar buzz right now. Arquette stopped by our studios this summer — when the film was released — to speak to Here & Now’s Robin Young about the experience of filming “Boyhood.”

Guest

  • Patricia Arquette, actress who stars in “Boyhood.” She tweets @PattyArquette.
